channel.title: Pimples/spots
channel.description:
So how do you get rid of these things?
I've personally had them since I was about 12, my main problem is that I get a pimple, then I either itch it or try to pop it and then it starts bleeding and I end up with 999 scabs on my face, I'm going to try my best not to do this from now.
I've tried a fuck load of those stupid "cleanser/spot clearers" none of them even work and most seem to give me more spots than I originally had.
So yeah bacon pillow discussion turn on

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

So like getting rid of them isnt my problem its keeping them from starting. I’ve been lucky and have never really had any bad acne or zits, I get the odd one every few months but my around my nose jesus fuck, must keep it clean other wise those bitches come out by the hundred.

KK BROLAPSE IM STEALIN UR THREAD. THIS THREAD IS NOW ABOUT HOW TO KEEP FACE CLEAN TO START WITH.

See above, serious!

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

I have been fortunant to only get some very minor acne and I find the best way to get rid of it is to pop it, clean it with rubbing alcohol(warning: burns like hell) and then avoid getting anything on it in it or around it including sweat. usually clears up within a day or two for me.

this

fat cookies:

Dry the little fuckers out with some anti-septic or some sort of alcohol.
funny but i guess this too lol

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Welcome to pharmaceuticals, like I said i’m not a fan of any prescription meds. However I’m aware of their effectiveness but the sideeffects are something you need to definitely be wary of.

Cheers for the name.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:25, topic:364983”]Don’t waste money on commercial products.

If you have a serious spot/acne problem:

Go to the doctor, tell him/her the spots make you feel self conscious, get you bullied or whatever. Basically persuade the doctor to prescribe you magic pills (I forgot the name -.- ). The medication a doctor can give you will generally be cheaper and far more effective than anything you can buy over the counter.

Although I hate pharmaceuticals, and haven’t done this myself.[/quote]

As I said earlier in the post I think the pills are roaccutane. I reallly don’t reccomend going on these for minor acne. It has some really bad side effects and some of them, like back pain and dry lips, I still get even though I finished my course 2 years ago.

That being said they do work fucking wonders, but be prepared to have to put up with a lot of shit on them. They’ve also been linked to causing kidney/liver damage and you have to have regular blood tests while your on them.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Don’t waste money on commercial products.

If you have a serious spot/acne problem:

Go to the doctor, tell him/her the spots make you feel self conscious, get you bullied or whatever. Basically persuade the doctor to prescribe you magic pills (I forgot the name -.- ). The medication a doctor can give you will generally be cheaper and far more effective than anything you can buy over the counter.

Although I hate pharmaceuticals, and haven’t done this myself.

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I used to use clearasil when I was a teenager and had mild acne. I kind of agree with Silab about popping them, but I’d pop them, wash my face with water, and then put clearasil on the freshly popped pimples.
Thing with that though is that scarring can potentially occur.

Nowadays I don’t get any at all unless I have a sugar binge. And then I’ll get one or two.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:17, topic:364983”]Dry the little fuckers out with some anti-septic or some sort of alcohol. They can’t grow in dry conditions.
I’ve also heard that applying your spit in the morning is good but I personally wouldn’t vouch that one!

You should remember that your hands (even at the best of times) have a load of bacteria on them; way more than on your face. So less hand-face contact should improve things![/quote]

Requesting picture of fag_cookies in post your picture thread

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Dry the little fuckers out with some anti-septic or some sort of alcohol. They can’t grow in dry conditions.
I’ve also heard that applying your spit in the morning is good but I personally wouldn’t vouch that one!

You should remember that your hands (even at the best of times) have a load of bacteria on them; way more than on your face. So less hand-face contact should improve things!

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

I have moderate acne, and I’ve been using Benzoyl Peroxide for years.
It doesn’t work fast, but it does give me some decent results.
The only problem is, you need to be consistent, if you skip a few days, it’ll get back and stays for a while.

I’ve heard of Roaccutane, and you should only use it on doctor’s prescription, that shit is the “chemotherapy” under the anti-acne medicins.

R.I.P RSC:

I started with benzoyl peroxide (I think. Does it leave stains on textile?)

Yes, it does stain textile terribly, so you just have to avoid touching it immediately after putting it on. I usually wait like 5 mins before sleeping or putting on my clothes, just so it doesn’t stain.

PS: Stay away from crap like clearasil, it doesn’t work.
Benzoyl Peroxide is one of the few things that’s working for me, albeit very slow.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ve had really bad acne for quite some time. I guess it runs in the family, my grandma had pretty bad and my uncle even has scars because of it.

I started with benzoyl peroxide (I think. Does it leave stains on textile?) It didn’t work, so I got two tubes of stuff which I don’t know the name of. One for the morning, and one for before bedtime. It worked reasonably, but it did result in a very dry skin. So I was sent to the dermatologist. I guess she described antibiotics. I had to have my blood checked every month or so for cholesterol, which was pretty annoying.

I’m 19 now, and I only have light acne. Mostly just those pimples deep under the skin, but rarely those with white heads that you can pop.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I used to have at least moderate acne as a teenager, and I tried a lot of stuff such as face cleansers and even some prescription stuff, it never really worked though, and it just sort of went away when I got older (19+ as far as I can remember). So my advice would be to just wait it out

But my brother-in-law uses that ‘proactiv’ stuff and it seems to work pretty well for him.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Tried toothpaste before. didn’t have any effect. I also drink more water then any person I’ve met, I drink at least a liter with my dinner alone.

I’ve only just come to realise how hard it is to stop touching my face, I didn’t realise i even had this habit until recently. I touch my face because I feel a spot and so i try to squeeze it then i end up pinching it with my nails and it bleeds, or I itch my face. Just in the last half an hour I’ve had to stop myself touching my face about ten times, it’s ridiculous.

So going to train myself to not do it anymore and see how my face looks after that.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Use toothpaste, it works really well. Dab some on the spots, leave for 2-3 mins and then wash off. They’ll look worse to start with, but by the time you wake up they’ll nearly have gone.

If there really bad you can get some anti-biotics, but I found they didn’t work so well and ended going on isotretinoin (Roaccutane) for bad acne on my back. If you have bad acne, I do reccomend using this anti-biotic but the side effects are really really bad. Extreme skin dryness, lose the ability to concentrate, severe mood swings, nose bleeds, and other bad shit. I’ve heard that it even caused severe depression in a few ppl, but that’s probably bull.

oh yeh, Cumescape, you’re a faggot.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Drink water, or like mapu suggested, use benzoyl peroxide (I personally use Oxy-10). I’ve used it for like 2 months, it does its job but there’s little results on my face.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples/spots
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Best advise I can give is just don’t pick at them. I had/have pretty bad acne and nothing off the shelf works, visited the doctors and tried antibiotics 3 times for 3-5 weeks each time and that didn’t help either.

Oh, and when you wash your face use warm water, avoid bars of soap and use a soft towel and pat your face dry.

Read full topic
